definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: And today the wind is so heavy . we can't walk very easy.
sentences.chinese: 即的风好大啊，我们走起来都很清贫。

sentences.english: Now then you have chosen this poor industry, you should be content with it .
sentences.chinese: 既然选择了这个清贫的行业，就要安贫乐道。

sentences.english: Refuse to earthiness, accept poverty in quiet in the heart of one party sukhavati keep.
sentences.chinese: 拒绝尘世，接受清贫，在宁静中守着心灵的一方净土。

sentences.english: I also never because of our poor and puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 我也从不因为我家的清贫而感到困惑。

sentences.english: The privations of monastery life were evident in his appearance.
sentences.chinese: 从他的外表来看可以明显看出修道院生活的清贫。

sentences.english: Writing poems, calligraphy, painting and designing are his game and sustenance.
sentences.chinese: 一生清贫，诗书画及设计工作是我生命中的戏寄托。

sentences.english: Fang Zhimin's poor life rely his riches in the world of spirit as his pillar.
sentences.chinese: 方志敏的清贫生活依靠精神世界的富有作支柱。

sentences.english: On living a poor but clean life I insist.

definition: hard pressed for money/in financial straits
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
plain tea and simple food/(fig.) bread and water
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
